intro: Micropholis discolor, commonly known as the yellow-leafed hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in humid climates. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, bloom throughout the year in some regions. Micropholis discolor is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic qualities.
